rComments: His classes are generally easy, as long as you follow along with lectures and keep up with readings. Exams are very straightforward. No tricks or surprises which was helpful. If you need help/clarity ASK. He's pretty helpful with that. Lots of readings though. He made Russian Politics interesting.

I think Dr. Skrobacki is an AMAZING Professor and an amazing person. I found him to be very approachable and helpful. I further think that he is very caring and extremely knowledgeable. I think it would be a shame to graduate from UTSC and not take his class.
One of my favourite professor. Very understanding and helpful. He loves and knows what he teaches. If you take courses by him, you will learn and enjoy.
He was very interesting in terms of lecture style, readings compliment the course well. A very helpful prof. Take one of his classes and you will learn!

Really engaging prof. You can tell he is passionate about what he teaches. He was also very understanding when I had to hand in an assignment late and didn't take marks off, which was really nice of him. Helpful if you need help. I recommend taking his classes. He makes learning about EU politics fun and interesting.
Skrobacki is a great professor, he seems to really enjoy teaching. He is a fairly easy marker with good assignments and grade weights. Thank you "ladies and gentlemen"

If you talk to him out of class, he may be very rude and unpleasant. He obviously wants students to like him, but on a personal level he is not as nice as some people would see him. I have been disappointed with the way he communicated to me in a very disrespectful manner, because he obviously had some bad mode swings at the moment.

Had him for a number of courses. He says he is not ideologically driven, but his intro to globalization is really a polemic against the United States. Takes advantage of first year students and indoctrinates them with socialist theory. Can be interesting to listen to, at times.

Overall he was very professional with his teaching and was pretty clear for the most part. I find that he's lectures were totally related to the books you bought or rented. Happy to have him again for Global an Governance this upcoming Winter session.

Amazing prof, not all like him. But he's great. He's funny which makes lecture enjoyable and he's informative. He gets off topic a bit but thats what makes him Skrobacki. One of my favorite profs , I look for his classes to take.

Professor Skrobacki is a good guy, and while he might be a little awkward to talk to in person at first, you may discover he's actually quite nice.  Sometimes he goes off on tangents during his lectures. The material he teaches- textbook or otherwise, though, is solid.

I'm sorry, I made a mistake in my previous rating that was just posted prior to this one. I was not paying attention and instead of choosing 5 to indicate the best reviews, I choose 1 to rate professor Skrobacki. There should be rating of TAs as well on this site.

I've also taken c89, c42 with this awesome prof.  For those idiots who couldn't understand Skrobacki, you need to get your eyes de-waxed.  Skrobacki as one review said: is a model professor for all others.  He is more than fair enough marker and he cracks awesome jokes in class.  He definitely KNOWS his stuff about welfare state, Europe, Russia!!!!

So surprisingly he gave me an extension when he sensed that I was stressed out. His lectures are fun-he has a comical way of explaining academic topics. Don't e-mail him too much, ask questions during class. OOPS

Best male professor that I have ever had! No other professor has ever taken the trouble to write concise, explanatory and very helpful summary notes for every week?s lectures. Plus I was never given an extension by anyone else before! In all my university years I?ve always handed in my essays on time. So surprisingly, he gave an extension when he s

I was actually looking forward to taking this course. However, after taking it I regret it. The reason is because, I found it quite difficult to follow what he was saying. There was a large amount of readings, and when I sat in the lectures- the readings were not mentioned. The tutorial, was extremely dead as well because, no one read.

He's one of those profs where you either love him or hate him...I didn't like him. I found him to be really boring and he would ramble on about things that were irrelevant to the course. I didn't like how there were no slides, so it made things especially hard for me as a note taker to sift through his ramblings.
His lectures were completely irrelevant to the material though he had his moments when he would bring something important up. His lectures were also very boring and sleep inducing.
He's amazing. James Bond, pro-European, Welfare State defender... Take all the courses you can take with him!
He can be very interesting if you pay attention. Most of the time he is monotone and puts you to sleep, but he has his moments.
He is the James Bond of University Professors.

There is alot of course reading, honestly its best if you just read the summary in the books because in the exam, alot of the terms that we were asked to define i got from wikipedia and i ended up getting an 85 in my exam. Waldemar is a decent professor, his lectures are interesting if you take the effort to pay attention.

Skrobacki is very insightful in this course. He's very clear even though he has an accent. His understanding of the welfare state and what it can do socially and economically is uncanny. You'll never think of the welfare state the same way.

He's amazing! Take all his courses, you will not regret it! You will miss them and question what type of education you are getting from the rest of the courses you do! Extremely helpful and is knowledgeable and passionate about his field of study, the EU! C89 was a blast as well, never will see Russia and Russian politics the same way again!
Amazing, funny, intelligent, knowledgeable...just good! Take all his classes, trust him! His passion for the EU will be apparent and you wished he taught all the courses in Polisci
liked the tutorial teacher he explained soooo well i have to say better then the actual professor

Took his class on European Union Politics. Lectures were interesting but not useful at all for the final! I went to class just to listen, but didn't look at the study notes at all, just read from the texbooks, which were easy readings. Great prof, great class. Very approachable, and fair with marking as well. Definitely take classes with him!
